Pronunciation: tS i _ t S i . Q N _ f V n
Definition: Chee cheong fun is a popular dish in Singaporean cuisine. It is a smooth, soft, and delicate rice noodle roll that is typically served steamed or pan-fried either plain or filled with ingredients such as pork, shrimp, or vegetables. Chee Cheong Fun is often served with a savory soy sauce-based dressing and a sprinkling of sesame seeds. The dish can be found in many hawker centers, food courts, and dim sum restaurants in Singapore.
Example: 1. My favorite breakfast dish is a steaming plate of chee cheong fun, with a cup of kopi on the side!
